name: Juicy Butter-Infused Beef Burger Patties

ingredients.ingredient: cold unsalted butter or infused compound butter (e.g. garlic-herb), divided into 4 small cubes
cheese (optional, e.g. cheddar, Swiss, or American)

instructions: If using infused butter, prepare it ahead by melting butter with garlic or herbs, then chill until firm enough to cube.
Divide the ground beef into 4 portions (125g each).
Flatten each portion slightly and place a cube of cold butter (or infused butter) in the center.
Wrap the beef around the butter and gently form into a patty. Avoid overworking.
Season the outside of each patty generously with kosher salt and black pepper.
Heat a 5-ply stainless steel pan over medium-high heat until hot.
Place patties in the pan without crowding. Cook and flip as needed to prevent burning and ensure even browning.
Cook until the internal temperature reaches 135Â°F (medium), adding cheese slices during the final minute and covering briefly to melt.
Remove patties from the pan and let rest for 3 minutes before serving.

storage_tips.room_temp: Best enjoyed immediately after cooking and resting.
storage_tips.leftovers: Cooked patties can be refrigerated in an airtight container for up to 3 days. Reheat gently in a pan or oven to retain juiciness.
storage_tips.freezing_raw: Raw patties can be frozen for up to 3 months. For best results, freeze with parchment between layers and thaw in the fridge before cooking.
